review: the functions are good if you can make it work smoothly. Using it with my Samsung galaxy S3 it seems to really be slow and hang up while streaming.  I have yet to try it from a computer (casting to a television), so that may make a difference in speed. But my father who doesn't seem to have any issues with the speed of it, he loves it. In fact, the complains that he is now watching way too much Netflix. Overall though, if it works for you it is a great product with great functionality.add edit:  I added a star to my original rating of three stars.  I found that using my computer the unit is consistently working great (instead of my Samsung galaxy S3), it's been a pretty flawless watching experience. So apparently it does not work so well with my phone as the chrome Source, but fine when it's from my PC. Cool thing is that the distance from the chrome cast to the PC makes no difference. If my kids asked me to start a movie up in the bedroom from my office downstairs, from my computer I can do that. However, it's not as handy if you want to  stop, pause, fast-forward, etc.... You have to go back to your computer (unlike using my PS3 controllers as a remote when I stream Netflix through the PS3). But, with this cheap little device I do save the "wear and tear" on my PS3. I am about to purchase a third one in a minute.

review: It could not be easier to setup.  Almost too easy, if you like to tinker there is almost nothing to tinker with.  Step 1 plug it in.  Step 2 open the app and enter your WiFi password.  Step 3 no step 3. The only drawback is that it won't connect to 5ghz WiFi but if you have a dual band network you can have your phone or computer on the 5ghz network while the chromecast is on the 2.4ghz network (under most router configurations)Some people have complained that you have to plug it into a power source.... It's Not Magic!  It requires electricity to operate.
